message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of energy allocation for wireless communications with energy harvesting constraints. It involves the use of dynamic programming and convex optimization techniques to obtain structural results for the optimal energy allocation. This problem is closely related to information theory (cs.IT), as the goal is to maximize the throughput of the communication system. It also involves networked systems (cs.NI) and control theory (cs.SY), as the energy allocation is a control problem over a networked system. Additionally, the use of optimization techniques suggests that this paper may belong to the machine learning (cs.MA) or multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories.
